Name: Stela of Tyty
Description: The stela is framed by a torus moulding on three sides with a cavetto cornice with two lines of incised text at the top. The representations are divided into six sections, each with two people kneeling in front of an offering table. A horizontal line of text is incised at the top of each scene. At the bottom are eight short columns of text with a kneeling man in front of a small offering table in the left corner. The quality of the workmanship is rather hasty; there are no traces of paint.
